alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:52PM CDT until May 06 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-051400- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0002.220506T1200Z-220506T1800Z/ /CANO2.1.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 852 PM CDT Wed May 4 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, The creek reaches bankfull levels in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. High stages on small feeder streams could further result in greater-than-bankfull overflows to mainstem bottomlands. Croplands... pastures... and some secondary rural roads along and near Clear Boggy Creek are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
